The used data is from river
It is taken from the data folder provided by Wolfgang and has the following structure
The prebuild list of 31 averaged variables/features are increased through interactions between each other. This is done by building all interaction formulars with
So every feature besides e.coli will be multiplied with every other feature which leads to 466 features from which the Lasso-algorithms are selecting the most important.
here is an insight of the last 50 formulas
The features are getting selected through the lasso algorithm with cross validation without (1.row) or with (2.row) internal standardization of the features
The following 4 graphs show the the number of selected features (upper sclae) dependend on log lambda (lower scale)
The left dotted line shows the lambda with the minimal MSE - identified throug cross-validation
The right dotted line shows the lambda 1 standard deviation away from the with the minimal MSE - identified throug cross-validation (shall give a better generalization than minimum mse)
lambda 1se for lasso base cross standardized
9 different models were build in the very first code snippet:
- 5 from stepwise regression, with 1-5 explanatory variables (choosen with Information Criterion)

from the two cross validated lasso fits: fit_lasso_base_cross and fit_lasso_base_cross_stand (with internal standardization of features) I used lambda min and lambda-1se to get 4 lasso based models with the following modelnumbers:

The 4 Lasso based models were than used in the posterior function for validation. If in50, below90, below95, and in 95 are all == 5 â€“> the model is validated through the validation method from wolfgang.
The best Model was chosen by further checking statistical correctness and sorting R2 in descending order.
## river model N BP R2 n_obs stat_correct in50 below90 below95
Whats interesting is, that only the standardized models (07 & 09) were able to beat the stepwise builded models with this evaluation method.
